content.description:
Start right in the middle of the boulder. Do some easy first couple of moves up and past the big crack running through the base, then the slab begins. There are definitely holds the whole way, and the feet are virtually everywhere, with 'good' feet interspersed throughout as well. It get continously harder moves as you move up the rock, with the final moves possibly being the crux. You can go straight up for a harder variation, or cut right at the top to the decent incut crimp.

This is a good problem, a highball, that is mentally challenging to commit the final moves.
content.protection: Two pads are better than one, with a spotter adding that extra layer of comfort
content.location: Heading up the trail, before you get to the first noticeable boulder problem on the left, cut right on a little trail heading down. This is right after you ascend the rock staircase coming up the trail, and 'come around the corner'. You can see the top of the slab from here.

content.description: Starts directly in the middle of the boulder. sit start. match on the lowest useable section of the rail. Sloping rails and sharp crimps define the route, good body positions with delicate moves.
content.location:
Just around the corner and west of the

Super Slab

, this climb starts right in the middle of the boulder to the immediate west of the slab. Do a couple of moves straight up the sidepull/crimps, and you're done. It is short and sweet.

content.description: Start with both hands matched on the jug at about head level. Stand up and work your way up decent ledges and crimps, the moves get a little tougher as you go up. Topping out was probably the hardest part of this climb.
content.protection: A pad will suffice, but a spotter up top to your left (if facing the rock) might be a good idea, to keep you from smashing into it if you peel to the left.
content.location:
It is in between the easy cracks and path of most resistance, in the corner. If heading up the trail, right after the rock staircase and as you come up upon the 'first' boulder problem to your left, head down the trail to the left towards

Super Slab

area.

content.description: This is better defined by big face holds than the cracks really. Jugs, good jams, decent feet and a soft angle add up to make this one a decent warm-up for other stuff in the area
content.protection: A pad or two, and a spotter couldn't hurt.
content.location:
On the north face of the

Super Slab

, ascend any of the many cracks running up the face, or you can bypass crack climbing and just climb the face holds.

content.description: Center Route has a pretty awkward start with a fun finish. Start on a big, odd-shaped hold at the bottom right, and make a difficult move (or 2) to an okay slot. Once established, move up to a fun, sloping corner, then go up left to another fun sloper and topout.
content.location:
This is on Bulge Rock between

Moso Roof

and

Dasani

.
